info.title: Latitude Health API Document
info.description: Latitude Health standard backend application API document.

tags.name: User Management
tags.description: API endpoints for managing user accounts, roles, and permissions.

tags.name: Plan/Policy Configuration
tags.description: API endpoints for managing plan/policy documents and related configurations.

tags.name: Request Management or Reviewer's Dashboard
tags.description: Updated description for Request Management or Reviewer's Dashboard.

tags.name: Review, Request & Clinical Summary
tags.description: API endpoints for generating and managing review summaries, requests, and clinical summaries.

get.description: This endpoint return User details such as basic users info, its roles, role based permissions and global client app permissions.
get.summary: User details api to return users info, its roles, role based permissions and global client app permissions.

get.description: This endpoint retrieves a policy document by policy_id.

parameters.name: unique_policy_id
parameters.description: The unique identifier for the policy

delete.description: This endpoint deletes a document by policy_id.

parameters.name: unique_policy_id
parameters.description: The unique identifier for the policy

post.description: Export generated Review, Request & Clinical Summary in downlodable FHIR format or PDF (outbound)
post.summary: Export generated Review, Request & Clinical Summary

post.description: This API enables smart searching on the EMR and policy guidelines based on the provided request_id. It allows users to find relevant information quickly and efficiently.
post.summary: Perform a smart search on EMR and policy guidelines using request_id

parameters.name: policy_id
parameters.description: Id of temporary policy uploaded by user

parameters.name: question
parameters.description: Boolean flag indicating if a question is being asked

query.example: tell me what information is available in the given document from Past Medical History and HPI, Imaging and Lab Results, Procedures and Treatments, Related Claims and Authorizations

get.description: This API endpoint allows retrying specific summarization tasks that have failed during the previous attempt. If any task fails during the summarization process initiated by the 'upload_summarize_track' API, the failed tasks are included in the response of that API along with the successful results. You can retry those specific failed tasks using this API by providing the task ID and the summary type associated with the failed task.

parameters.name: summary_type
parameters.description: The type of summarization task to retry. This should match the summary type of the failed task.

parameters.name: task_id
parameters.description: The unique identifier of the failed task to retry.

get.description: This endpoint retrieves the review summary based on the clinical summary and plan guidelines. It serves as a decision API for approving or denying requests.

parameters.name: policy_id
parameters.description: Id of temporary policy uploaded by user

post.description: Add policy documents to facilitate semantic search and analysis for policy-related information

put.description: This endpoint updates a policy document and its related fields.

parameters.name: uuid
parameters.description: The unique identifier for the policy document

get.description:
This API provides continuous progress updates on the extraction process. 
        When the extraction process is complete, it will return the summarization as the result. 
        It takes the task ID which is provided under post call of 'upload_summarize_track' API.
get.summary: Fetch summarization progress and its response using task id

post.description:
This API allows you to upload multiple PDF/FHIR format medical-record/EMR files. 
                    and it will provide you with the ID of the task which includes uploading text extraction and summarization.
                    This task will run at backend and you can track this task using provided ID used as param in this endpoint upload_summarize_track
post.summary: Upload PDF/FHIR format medical-record/EMR files and generate summarization

post.description: This endpoint allows users to add a new user by providing necessary data.
post.summary: Add a New User via Public API

put.description: This endpoint allows users to logout by invalidating the access token.

post.description: This endpoint allows Sign In using Microsoft login validator based on access_token.
post.summary: Microsoft Login Validation with Access Token

get.description: This endpoint allows listing the role master data.
This endpoint allows listing all users present in the table for a specific tenant.
get.summary: List All Users for a Tenant

put.description: This endpoint allows saving or updating roles for a user.
This endpoint uses the PUT method to activate or deactivate users one at a time.

post.description: This endpoint returns a list of EDI278 records with pagination, filters, and sorting.

items.description: Date or date range in format YYYY-MM-DD or YYYY-MM-DD to YYYY-MM-DD

due_date.description: List of dates or date ranges for filtering records

search.description: Search records by request ID, member name, provider name, or code

order_by.description: Field to order by (request_id, member_name, due_date, status)

get.description: This endpoint allows users to retrieve a specific EDI278 record.

post.description: This endpoint allows users to create a new EDI278 record or inbound FHIR request by uploading data PA authorisation in pdf/json format
post.summary: Create a new EDI278 record or inbound FHIR request.

put.description: This endpoint allows users to update specific fields of an EDI278 record.

delete.description: This endpoint allows users to delete an EDI278 record by providing necessary data.

get.description: This endpoint will be used to get the summary of the plan guidelines of a specified EDI request.
get.summary: Plan guideline summary for EDI request

parameters.name: policy_id
parameters.description: Id of temporary policy uploaded by user

get.summary: Pull structured clinical information from client's system

parameters.name: client_id
parameters.description: The unique identifier for the client

404.description: Client not found or no clinical information available

StatusE59Enum.description:
* `NEW` - New
* `IN-PROGRESS` - In-Progress
* `HOLD` - On Hold
* `APPROVED` - Approved
* `REJECTED` - Rejected
